Arnold Split

6 Day Split

Bodybuidling Focus

Whether you are an ambitious novice looking to sculpt an Adonis physique or a veteran bodybuilder seeking inspiration, chances are you've heard of the iconic Arnold Schwarzenegger and his signature 6-day split.

This workout plan was developed by Arnold in partnership with other professional bodybuilders to cultivate a massive frame and peak muscle performanceâ€”and it delivered! What makes this routine distinct from the average two- or three-day split is its intense volume approach organized into six intense but achievable daily workouts.

In this article, I will provide a detailed overview of the Arnold split as well as tips on how to adjust the program for your individual needs.

Overview

Arnold Schwarzenegger made impressive gains from the Arnold split, a demanding and high-volume workout routine for those who are up for the challenge. Stick with it, and you will reap the rewards.

A typical workout plan involves working each muscle group twice a week with high volume consisting of 3-4 sets per movement ranging from 6-25 reps.

Advanced lifters with consistent training habits and knowledge of nutrition and recovery should attempt this routine.

How To Implement

If you're looking to follow the Arnold Split, then it's important to know how to properly implement it. This type of workout routine is designed to be done six days/a week, focusing on different muscle groups on each day. The typical order involves first training your chest and back, followed by shoulders and arms, and finishing with legs and lower back.

You have the option of choosing which days to work out; most people do the routine Monday-Saturday and rest on Sundays. If that's too much for you, you can choose to take a rest day after exercise number three so as not to overload your body or disrupt your training or resting schedules during the week. That said, taking a rest day every third day will no longer be following a standard 7-day rotation as some of your exercises or rest days may spill over into another work week.

Example Routine:

Pros

The Arnold Split has some clear-cut pros and benefits that make it a great routine for bodybuilders looking to maximize their workout.

• The primary benefit of a split-body workout is that it allows you to work all antagonistic muscle groups within the same session, which helps you get more done in less time. Furthermore, each muscle group gets several days of rest between workouts to ensure adequate recovery.

• This plan provides balanced training by allowing you to focus on developing each muscle group twice a week and work on weak areas, thus reducing the risk of injuries. Additionally, it also gives you the chance to put more focus on particular muscle groups on different days for improved performance results.

Cons

The 6-Day Split - Arnold Split is a demanding workout program with many pros, but it also comes with some cons to consider.

• This program demands time and dedication. With the exercises, you will have to do and the wait for equipment in the gym, it can take up to two hours per day when performing a full six-day split. Furthermore, missed days can put a halt to reaping its benefits.

• The other downside is that it lacks flexibility. With such a demanding program, there's little room to squeeze in additional types of exercise like HIIT or marathon training because of the intense physical and mental strain it requires, leaving less time and energy for other workouts.

Conclusion

The 6-day split workout plan used by Arnold Schwarzenegger is a great way to get in shape and build muscle. It is not only effective for both beginner and experienced bodybuilders alike but also enjoyable, allowing you to tailor your training routine to best suit your needs. With this plan, focus on progressive overload and rest days will ensure that you make the most of your workouts. With a focused effort and an optimization of this routine, you can be just like Arnold!
